This was the only busy restaurant we walked past last night so we decided it must be good - we were right. I can't remember the exact spanish names on the menu but we ordered the ribs and a fish dish. The ribs came out sizzling hot and the meat practically fell off the bone as soon as I touched my knife to it. It was about half a rack (maybe more) and covered in barbecue sauce with more on the side. I ordered grilled veggies as a side and those were so good as well. The fish was tender and sat on some sort of cornbread thing covered with a mild peanut flavored sauce along with spinach, radishes, and sliced peaches - resulted in a unique flavor. There's indoor and outdoor seating (heated). Servers were very friendly. Beer is good. Come here if you are visiting the port and want a change from the typical Spanish dishes.I will say that it was pretty loud inside as it was packed and music was playing, but it is kid friendly as there were several families there with kids.
